gable.name: Gable Roof (+5%)
gable.description: Simple triangular shape formed by two sloping sides meeting at a ridge. Most cost-effective and suitable for most climates. Includes a 5% cost adjustment for complexity.
gable.bestFor: Most residential applications, budget-conscious projects, areas with moderate weather
gable.complexity: Low - Simple construction and installation with 5% cost premium

shed.name: Shed Roof
shed.description: Single sloping plane that provides modern aesthetics and excellent water runoff. Simple construction with contemporary appeal.
shed.bestFor: Modern homes, additions, excellent water drainage needs

materials.title: Materials
materials.description: Choosing the right roofing material is crucial for longevity, cost-effectiveness, and aesthetic appeal. Each material has unique properties, installation requirements, and cost implications.

materialList.name: Corrugated (0.4mm)
materialList.description: Lightweight corrugated steel sheet suitable for budget-friendly installs.
materialList.bestFor: Residential and commercial buildings, budget-conscious projects

materialList.name: Corrugated (0.5mm)
materialList.description: Thicker corrugated panel offering better rigidity and lifespan.
materialList.bestFor: Residential and commercial buildings, areas with heavy weather

materialList.name: Long Span (0.4mm)
materialList.description: Modern long span profile with excellent water drainage.
materialList.pros: Durable, weather-resistant, excellent water drainage, modern appearance
materialList.bestFor: Modern homes, commercial buildings, areas with heavy rainfall

materialList.name: Long Span (0.5mm)
materialList.description: Premium long span thickness for maximum durability and structure.
materialList.pros: Maximum durability, excellent water drainage, superior structural integrity
materialList.bestFor: Premium projects, commercial buildings, extreme weather conditions

selectionGuide.description: Consider local weather patterns and temperature extremes
Factor in initial cost vs. long-term value
Ensure your roof can support the material weight
Look for materials that reduce heating/cooling costs
Check building regulations and fire safety requirements

ridgeCaps.name: Corrugated Ridge Cap
ridgeCaps.description: Traditional ridge cap designed for corrugated roofing sheets. Provides weather protection and proper ventilation at roof peaks.

ridgeCaps.name: Long Span Ridge Cap
ridgeCaps.description: Modern ridge cap for long span roofing profiles. Features enhanced water drainage and contemporary appearance.

gutters.name: Pre-painted GI Gutter
gutters.description: Galvanized iron gutter with factory-applied paint coating. Offers durability and color options for aesthetic appeal.

gutters.name: Stainless Gutter
gutters.description: Premium stainless steel gutter system. Highly corrosion-resistant and ideal for coastal or high-humidity environments.

gutters.name: PVC Gutter
gutters.description: Lightweight plastic gutter system. Easy to install, maintenance-free, and available in various colors to match your roof.

screws.name: Roofing Screw with Washer
screws.description: Standard roofing screw with rubber washer for watertight seal. Essential for securing roofing sheets to structural supports.

screws.name: Self-Drilling Hex Head
screws.description: Self-drilling screw with hex head for easy installation. Drills through metal without pre-drilling, saving time and effort.

screws.name: Self-Tapping Hex Head
screws.description: Self-tapping screw with hex head design. Creates threads in pre-drilled holes for secure fastening in metal applications.

screws.name: TEK Screw
screws.description: High-performance self-drilling screw with sharp point. Ideal for fastening metal roofing to steel purlins and structural members.

screws.name: Tile Screw
screws.description: Specialized screw for tile roofing applications. Designed to securely fasten tiles without cracking or damaging the material.

screws.name: Concrete Screw
screws.description: Heavy-duty screw for concrete applications. Used for securing roofing components to concrete walls or foundations.

insulation.name: Fiberglass Batt
insulation.description: Traditional fiberglass insulation in batt form. Easy to install between roof joists, provides excellent thermal resistance and sound dampening.

insulation.name: Foam Board
insulation.description: Rigid foam insulation boards with high R-value per inch. Moisture-resistant and ideal for continuous insulation applications.

insulation.name: Reflective Roll
insulation.description: Reflective insulation roll that reflects radiant heat. Lightweight, easy to install, and particularly effective in hot climates.

insulation.name: Spray Foam
insulation.description: Expanding spray foam insulation that fills gaps and provides air sealing. High R-value and excellent for irregular spaces.

insulation.name: Mineral Wool
insulation.description: Fire-resistant mineral wool insulation made from rock or slag. Excellent thermal and acoustic properties with superior fire resistance.

ventilation.name: Ridge Vent
ventilation.description: Continuous ventilation system installed along the roof ridge. Provides maximum airflow while maintaining weather protection.

ventilation.name: Turbine Vent
ventilation.description: Wind-powered rotating vent that extracts hot air from attic space. Self-powered and highly effective in windy conditions.

ventilation.name: Static Roof Vent
ventilation.description: Fixed roof vent that provides passive ventilation. Simple design with weather-resistant construction for reliable performance.

ventilation.name: Soffit Vent
ventilation.description: Intake vent installed in the soffit area. Allows fresh air to enter the attic and creates proper airflow circulation.

ventilation.name: Exhaust Fan
ventilation.description: Powered ventilation fan for active air extraction. Ideal for high-moisture areas and can be controlled with timers or humidistats.

calculator.title: Calculator
calculator.description: The RoofCal calculator is the heart of our platform, providing accurate cost estimates through an intuitive step-by-step process. Follow this guide to maximize accuracy and efficiency.

workflow.description: Enter basic project details including project name, location, and description. Location helps determine regional pricing and climate considerations.
Choose from our available roof types (Gable or Shed). Gable roofs include a 5% cost adjustment for complexity.
Input roof dimensions using our measurement tools:
details: Pitch/Slope: Roof angle for accurate surface area calculation
Waste Factor: Automatic 10% addition for cuts and overlaps

workflow.description: Choose roofing materials with real-time pricing updates. Compare options with cost breakdowns and lifespan projections.
Review the detailed cost breakdown and save your project for future reference or client presentation.

Save your calculations for future reference and client presentations
